intro: Cnestis setosa, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its milky sap is a distinguishing feature, which can be toxic to some animals. Cnestis setosa is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
